intro: Galactia tenuiflora, commonly known as the slenderflower burr. It is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or bean family. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring, followed by pod-like fruits that contain seeds. The plant is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
